page.title: 20TRANSPORT AND COMMUNICATION
page.content: Transport here is much the same as anywhere else. Nearly every household owns a car or form of motor vehicle, possibly two in some cases. In Mengham there is a bus station which runs buses nos. 301 and 302 from Havant Bus Station to Hayling holiday centres and no. 702 from Hayling to Southsea. There was once a railway and this was discontinued in 1963,but the track and old station can still be seen. There is only one road off the Island which causes problems during the holiday season. We have several public telephones and a phone in nearly every house. We also have one post office in our area.
